I'vewated to play a VR game that allows you to practice using a sword. I liked star wars games like Vader Immortal and Blade and Socery, but the fighting was either too glitchy or too 1 dimensional. This does have some problems with the bow staff, but i still like the style, the combat, as well as the blocking and parrying. I constantly find myself having fun because it allows me to level up without freezing, like Blade and Sorcery, but less frustrating with glitches, such as Vader.

The game itself is very fun if you can get the hang of it, however, it is too unbalanced to be a truly fun game. For, example, the ninja is practically useless agaisnt any classes that have shields, the monk is too fast to block for most people without shields. The game needs balancing urgently. I want to give it five stars and say it's without flaw, I really do, but right now it's too unbalanced to do that.

There are very few decent Sword fighting games for VR and only two sword fighting games for the Quest, with Ironlights being the only one offering duels (The other one, Swords of Gargantua, feels less polished, and no duels). I used to do fencing myself and this game does capture the vibe pretty well. It is the first game that I bought on release.
The game graphics are of course rather minimalistic, evidently designed with the Quest hardware in mind. On the Quest it runs very smoothly.  
Have to disagree with the reviews that say the game is unbalanced. You just have to figure out whether to attack from afar or from up close, and whether your class is better at one or the other. I very rarely leave reviews, but for this game I had to put pen to paper, as it is really good.
